Discussion Topic

Let's see what you've learned about the ages and stages of discipline methods. Read the situation, then decide which discipline method each parent could use with their child that would be age-appropriate.

Situations

1. Rachel is just over 12 months old. She is playing with a toy and begins banging it on the coffee table. Rachel's father takes the toy out of her hand and firmly says, "No banging." She then picks up another toy and starts banging again. (Answer: B)

2. Ulysses, a 2-year-old, has been waiting for dinner while his mom is on the phone. He played quietly for about 10 minutes, but is now starting to become bored and begins making noise to get his mother's attention. (Answer: C)

3. Thomas is a 4-year-old. He was riding in the car with his mom when they were almost hit by another car. Thomas' mom yelled at the other car. Now at home, Thomas is playing with his cars and pretending to have them hit each other, then yell at each other. (Answer: A)

  • Discipline Methods

    A. Acknowledge the mistake in modeling and talk with the child.

    B. Distract the child with a different toy or activity.

    C. Praise the child's effort, then redirect to a new activity.

    Sample Feedback

    Parents should keep in mind that not every method is effective in any given situation. Parents should consider the different methods of discipline and use the appropriate one for each unique circumstance.
